revised_title: Dental Homologies and Notation System in Mammals
tldr: The author, Richard Owen, examines the development and homologies of molar teeth in wart-hogs and proposes a system of notation for teeth in the mammalian class. He refutes previous theories on dentition and identifies two sets of teeth in mammals, called 'Monophyodonts' and 'Diphyodonts'. The author introduces a new notation system for teeth based on their homologies, which can be applied co-extensively within the mammalian class.
